article_title: BP, Sainsbury, Lloyds, Tullow Oil: U.K., Irish Equity Preview
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"JV36ZR0D9L36","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2008-01-23/bp-sainsbury-lloyds-tullow-oil-u-k-irish-equity-preview"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-SJe8wZv"}   The following is a list of companies whose shares may have unusual price changes in the U.K. and Irish markets. Stock symbols are in parentheses after company names and prices are from the last close.    The FTSE 100 rose 161.90, or 2.9 percent, to 5,740.10. The FTSE All-Share Index rose 2.9 percent to 2,928.60. Ireland's ISEQ Index rose 3.8 percent to 6,496.87.    {"contentId":"JV36ZR0D9L36","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[1,8]],"small_desktop":[[1,8]],"tablet":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2008-01-23/bp-sainsbury-lloyds-tullow-oil-u-k-irish-equity-preview"},"containerId":"outstream-video-1-JV36ZR0D9L36"}   {"contentId":"JV36ZR0D9L36","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"mobile":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2008-01-23/bp-sainsbury-lloyds-tullow-oil-u-k-irish-equity-preview"},"containerId":"outstream-video-2-JV36ZR0D9L36"}   U.K. Companies:    {"contentId":"JV36ZR0D9L36","position":"box","dimensions":{"mobile":[[300,250],[3,3],[1,1],"fluid"]},"type":"Mobile Body Box Ad","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"box1","positionIncrement":1,"url":"/news/articles/2008-01-23/bp-sainsbury-lloyds-tullow-oil-u-k-irish-equity-preview"},"containerId":"box-2zTBzkY"}   BP Plc (BP/ LN): Europe's second-largest oil company and federal prosecutors urged a U.S. judge to reject victim requests for a fine of as much as $2 billion to resolve criminal charges over a 2005 blast that killed 15 workers at the company's refinery in Texas City, Texas. The stock rose 7.5 pence, or 1.5 percent, to 526.5 pence.    British Energy Group Plc (BGY LN): The company whose nuclear reactors can produce about a fifth of the U.K.'s electricity halted Unit 2 at its Torness nuclear power plant near Dunbar on the east coast of Scotland. The stock rose 9.5 pence, or 1.9 percent, to 506 pence.  {"contentId":"JV36ZR0D9L36","position":"desktop-in-article1","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[5,4]],"small_desktop":[[5,4]]},"type":"Desktop in article Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"desktop-in-article1","url":"/news/articles/2008-01-23/bp-sainsbury-lloyds-tullow-oil-u-k-irish-equity-preview"},"containerId":"desktop-in-article-1-JV36ZR0D9L36"}   FirstGroup Plc (FGP LN): Britain's biggest train operator was raised to ``neutral'' from ``sell'' at Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. The shares climbed 41.5 pence, or 7.1 percent, to 630 pence.  GlaxoSmithKline Plc (GSK LN): Merrill Lynch & Co. raised its recommendation on the world's second-largest drugmaker to ``neutral'' from ``sell,'' citing the stock's recent declines.  ``The recent sell-off has provided some longer-term buying opportunities for higher-quality higher-growth companies,'' London-based analysts including Graham Parry wrote in a research note today. The stock has fallen 9.2 percent since Jan. 9.  {"contentId":"JV36ZR0D9L36","position":"in-article1","dimensions":{"mobile":[[5,19],[300,250],[3,3],[1,1],"fluid"],"tablet":[[5,11],[728,90],[1,1]]},"type":"In Article Flex Native Ad","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"in-article1","positionIncrement":1,"url":"/news/articles/2008-01-23/bp-sainsbury-lloyds-tullow-oil-u-k-irish-equity-preview"},"containerId":"in-article-1-JV36ZR0D9L36"}   J Sainsbury Plc (SBRY LN): Britain's third-biggest supermarket chain said the Qatar Investment Authority now directly owns a 25 percent stake in the company after turning financial instruments into shares. The stock rose 9.75 pence, or  2.6 percent, to 383.75 pence.  Legal & General Group Plc (LGEN LN): Societe Generale cut its recommendation on the U.K.'s fourth-biggest insurer to ``sell'' from ``buy.'' The shares climbed 5.3 pence, or 4.3 percent, to 127.3.  Lloyds TSB Group Plc (LLOY LN): Goldman raised its recommendation to ``neutral'' from ``sell.''  Separately ABN Amro Holding NV cut the stock to ``sell.'' ``We lower full-year 2008 earnings per share for the domestic U.K. banks by an average 27 percent,'' ABN analysts wrote in a research note. The shares rose the most since March 2000, by 34.5 pence, or 9.2 percent, to 408.  {"contentId":"JV36ZR0D9L36","position":"desktop-in-article2","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[5,4]],"small_desktop":[[5,4]]},"type":"Desktop in article Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"desktop-in-article2","url":"/news/articles/2008-01-23/bp-sainsbury-lloyds-tullow-oil-u-k-irish-equity-preview"},"containerId":"desktop-in-article-2-JV36ZR0D9L36"}   New Star Asset Management Group Ltd. (NSAM LN): HSBC Holdings Plc cut its price estimate by 53 percent to 140 pence. Shares of the fund company set up by John Duffield in 2000 lost 1 penny, or 0.9 percent, to 105.75.  Prudential Plc (PRU LN): Ping An Insurance (Group) Co. may spend 100 billion yuan ($13.8 billion) to buy a stake in Prudential, the U.K.'s second-biggest insurer, the 21st Century Business Herald cited an unidentified person familiar with the matter as saying.  Reed Elsevier Plc (REL LN): The owner of the LexisNexis database bought Italy's Edra SpA to bolster its online data business. The stock rose 28.5 pence, or 4.9 percent, to 614 pence.  {"contentId":"JV36ZR0D9L36","position":"in-article2","dimensions":{"mobile":[[5,19],[300,250],[3,3],[1,1],"fluid"]},"type":"In Article Flex Native Ad","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"in-article2","positionIncrement":1,"url":"/news/articles/2008-01-23/bp-sainsbury-lloyds-tullow-oil-u-k-irish-equity-preview"},"containerId":"in-article-2-JV36ZR0D9L36"}   Thomson Intermedia Plc (THN LN): A U.K. provider of advertising analysis for clients including Ford Motor Co. said first half revenue was 8.4 million pounds. The stock fell 1 penny, or 1.7 percent, to 56.5 pence.  Tullow Oil Plc (TLW LN): The U.K. explorer with the most exploration licenses in Africa said it raised production by 13 percent last year after drilling more wells. The stock rose 29.5 pence, or 5.7 percent, to 547.5 pence.  Vodafone Group Plc (VOD LN): The world's largest mobile-phone operator by sales may offer to buy German railway Deutsche Bahn AG's remaining stake in fixed-line telephone operator Arcor AG, the Financial Times Deutschland reported. The stock rose 2.6 pence, or 1.5 percent, to 173 pence.  Woolworths Group Plc (WLW LN): UBS AG lowered its price estimate on the stock by 33 percent to 8 pence. Share of the company whose 820 U.K. stores sell goods from household appliances to children's clothes added 0.26 pence, or 3.2 percent, to 8.43.
